cookie.text: This site uses technical cookies and, only if you consent, Google Analytics 4 to analyse MacroPT Titanium usage in aggregate form. You can read the details in the Privacy Policy.

hero.title: Serious nutrition planning for people who think in macros.
hero.subtitle: MacroPT Titanium lets you set C/P/F targets, create recipes, compose meals, plan the week and generate a professional shopping list.

how.title: How MacroPlanner Titanium works
how.subtitle: It‚Äôs not just a calorie counter. It‚Äôs a planner built for people who want to manage macros, recipes and their week with precision and consistency.

step1.title: Set your goals
step1.text: Define your daily carbohydrate, protein and fat targets once, and how to distribute them across breakfast, lunch, snack and dinner. Per-meal tolerance included.

step2.title: Build your recipes
step2.text: Create recipes with real ingredients and nutrition values. The planner calculates macros and kcal per serving, so you don‚Äôt have to reinvent the numbers every time.

step3.title: Plan the week
step3.text: Assign recipes to the week‚Äôs meals, recalculate and immediately see tolerance badges, achieved macros and where you‚Äôre off. If something is wrong, you change the recipe or grams, you don‚Äôt ‚Äúhope‚Äù.

step4.title: Generate the shopping list
step4.text: With one click you get the full shopping list: ingredients, total grams, grams per pack and number of packs. From planner to trolley, without manual calculations.

for_whom.title: Who it‚Äôs for
for_whom.text: For people who want to know exactly what they‚Äôre eating, not ‚Äúmore or less‚Äù. Athletes, coaches, anyone following a plan who doesn‚Äôt want to redo the math every week.

not_do.title: What it DOESN‚ÄôT do
not_do.text: It‚Äôs not a social network, it has no useless notifications and it doesn‚Äôt give ‚Äúmagic advice‚Äù. It gives you tools, numbers and order. Decisions remain yours.

demo.title: A look inside MacroPlanner Titanium
demo.subtitle: Three real examples of what you see when using the tool: the balanced meal, the split version and the full recipe.
demo.card1_text: Meal name, macros and calories are already aligned with your daily targets. No need to double-check manually: the planner has already done it.
demo.card2_title: The same meal, on two plates
demo.card2_text: The system takes the same meal and splits it into first and second course, keeping total carbohydrates, proteins, fats and kcal identical.
demo.card3_text: Weighed ingredients, gram quantities and a structure ready to generate the shopping list with the number of packs to buy.

auth.title: MacroPlanner Titanium
auth.subtitle: Log in with email and password to use the planner.

messages.signupMissingFields: Enter email and password to sign up.
messages.signupSuccess: Sign up successful. Check your email, confirm your address and then log in.
messages.signupUnexpectedError: Sign up failed due to an unexpected error.

mealSplit.title: Meal split
mealSplit.ingredientsInfo: Grams are for the whole recipe; the solver distributes C/P/F across enabled meals.

recipes.title: Your recipes
recipes.hintCreateFromTitle: You can create a new recipe starting from the meal title.

perMeal.configureHint: Set default grams and FIXED for this ingredient only in the meals where the recipe is enabled (those selected above).
perMeal.removeHint: Removes the recipe only from the current meal, not from the recipes archive.
perMeal.fixedGramsPrompt: "{ingredient}" ‚Äì {meal}: fixed grams (leave empty for no override)

autoFromLabels.noIngredients: No ingredients (select recipes and recalculate the week).

photoImport.subtitle: Upload a label photo: I‚Äôll prepare a draft, then you confirm.
photoImport.errNoOpenRecipe: Open a recipe (click its title) before importing an ingredient.
photoImport.errSumTooHigh: Unusual macro values: the sum per 100g is too high. Check the label.
photoImport.warnOcrLowConfidence: I read the label, but please double-check the values.
photoImport.errOcrFailed: Label reading failed. Please enter macros manually.
photoImport.errOcrNoMacros: I couldn‚Äôt read the macros. Please enter them manually.

shopping.title: Weekly shopping list
shopping.subtitle: Automatically build your shopping list from the week‚Äôs meals.
shopping.note: Ingredient values are per 100 g. Packages are estimated from total grams.
shopping.note2: You can set default grams for each ingredient.
shopping.note4: Data is saved locally. Import/Export also includes planner and recipe library.
shopping.note5: Click the recipe title to open/close composition. Ingredient library is reusable.

history.title: Day history
history.subtitle: Save and review your days with macro targets.

weight.title: Weight trend
weight.subtitle: Log your weight and track your progress.
weight.description: Values are saved in the planner and included in the JSON Export (key "pesoLog"). You can edit or delete each entry in the table.

alerts.removeIngredientConfirm: Remove this ingredient from the recipe?
alerts.noMealsEnabledForRecipe: No meals are enabled for this recipe. Enable at least one meal in the settings.
alerts.remoteJsonUseError: Unable to use the imported JSON.
alerts.remoteJsonDownloadError: Error while downloading the remote JSON.

dailyTotals.title: Daily totals vs targets
dailyTotals.explainerHtml: The summary only includes meals with a mathematical solution and compares totals to targets (for indicative, non-binding checks).

misc.toleranceNote: The summary only includes meals with a calculated solution (hit "Recalculate" on meals). Tolerance: ¬±{pct}% on C/P/F (kcal are informational, not strict).
misc.autoLoadTodayNote: When enabled, today‚Äôs menu is automatically loaded on open.
misc.dataSavedLocally: Data is saved locally in your browser (no automatic cloud backup).

quickStart.title: First run (30s)
quickStart.body:
• Set your daily Targets (C/P/F).
  • Add recipes to meals or enter manual macros.
  • Press Save day to store your menu.

targets.title: Targets and day
targets.body:
• Targets drive your daily totals and remaining macros.
  • When you edit a recipe/ingredient, totals update automatically.

split.title: Split (First/Second)
split.body:
• Splits a meal into two parts while keeping the meal total consistent.
  • Each part can use a recipe or manual macros.
  • Use the part target to balance first and second course.

recipes.title: Recipes and ingredients
recipes.body:
• Create recipes with ingredients and quantities.
  • Recipes can be attached to meals and to Split.

shopping.title: Shopping list
shopping.body:
• Generate the list from your saved days/meals.
  • If you set pack sizes, you can estimate how many packs to buy.

data.title: Weight, history, export
data.body:
• Log weight to track the trend.
  • Export/import for backups or device changes.
